history.content:
1) If you fall under the unit count, you'll get a warning.

2) If you're referring to the Late Change of Class Schedule, then the class does not show up at all on your transcript. It's akin to a drop before the deadline.

3) It'll be like it's the first time you've taken it.

4) You only need signatures if you fall within those categories.

children.subject: Yes, you'll get a warning and that's it. But if it happens again (falling under the unit floor; you don't get another late drop), then there may be consequences.
Regarding answer 1, are you allowed to fall under the unit count in this case?

history.content:
Hi everybody, I know today is the add/drop deadline but I have a couple questions regarding the emergency drop. I'm considering dropping a L/S CS major pre-req if I end up doing poorly and taking it later (I met with some course advisers already who told me this was something to consider). I did read the other posts but couldn't find much information.

1) If I currently have 14 units and emergency drop a 4-unit class, is that allowed (am I allowed to fall under the unit count)? I'm not on financial aid so I'm not worried about the drop affecting that.

2) How does the drop show up on my transcript? Does the class still show up, and if so, what does it say?

3) When I retake the class, how does this show up in terms of grading? Is the class that is dropped completely gone, and the new/only grade for the class I retook used for the 3.3 GPA requirement? (My adviser seemed to be a bit confused and mentioned averaging the new grade and a 1.7, but I thought that was only if I decided to P/NP the class). 

4) How do you fill out the form (https://ls.berkeley.edu/sites/default/files/advlatechangeclassschedule.pdf) and what is the process in doing so-- what do I put for reason of drop, and if I'm not any of the other categories (declared major, student athlete, etc.) is the only signature I need to get before I turn it in my L/S CS advisor's? 

Thank you for all your help in advance!
history.subject: Emergency Drop Policy
